text: Kids, just because I don’t care doesn’t mean I’m not listening.
author: Homer Simpson

text: It takes two to lie, one to lie, and one to listen.
author: Homer Simpson

text: Operator! Give me the number for 911!
author: Homer Simpson

text: Between your genius and my nothing we make a great team, come on give me a hug!
author: Homer Simpson

text: Oh God gets your prayers, but he just clicks delete without reading them...
author: Homer Simpson

text: No no honey, I love everything you force me to do.
author: Homer Simpson

text: D’oh!
author: Homer Simpson

text: You're going to stay your current ages for the rest of your lives.
author: Marge Simpson

text: Halloween is a very strange holiday. Personally, I don’t understand it. Kids worshipping ghosts, pretending to be devils.
author: Marge Simpson

text: Today he's drinking people's blood. Tomorrow he could be smoking.
author: Marge Simpson

text: Bart! Stop pestering Satan.
author: Marge Simpson

text: If someone did eat Bart's shorts they'd have a tummy full of pocket garbage.
author: Marge Simpson

text: Lisa, you’re learning many lessons tonight. And one of them is to always give your mother the benefit of the doubt.
author: Marge Simpson

text: I can’t promise I’ll try, but I’ll try to try.
author: Bart Simpson

text: I didn't think it was physically possible, but this...blows.
author: Bart Simpson

text: I think Grandpa smells like that trunk in the garage where the bottom's all wet.
author: Bart Simpson

text: Very scary, Mr. Flanders, but I've got a story so scary you'll wet your pants.
author: Bart Simpson

text: If you don't watch the violence, you'll never get desensitized to it.
author: Bart Simpson

text: So much for the days when I could say, 'At least my mother's normal.
author: Bart Simpson

text: If you take away our cartoons, we'll grow up without a sense of humor and be robots.
author: Lisa Simpson

text: I think you need Skinner, Bart. Everybody needs a nemesis.
author: Lisa Simpson

text: I'm proud of you, Mom. You're like Christopher Columbus. You discovered something millions of people knew about before you.
author: Lisa Simpson

text: Don't you see? Getting what you want all time will ultimately leave you unfulfilled and joyless.
author: Lisa Simpson

text: Shut up, brain. I got friends now. I don't need you anymore.
author: Lisa Simpson

text: Mom, look, I found something more fun than complaining!
author: Lisa Simpson

text: Well I can't say for sure, but as a Christian, I assume the worst.
author: Ned Flanders

text: Can I make my famous mimosa? A little sparkling water in a glass full of regular water?
author: Ned Flanders

text: That sounds salty, but you seem sweet. I'm going to call you kettle corn.
author: Ned Flanders

text: Now what can I ding dong diddly do for you?
author: Ned Flanders

text: Just tell them that God wants them to ignore everything in their bodies that God is making happen.
author: Ned Flanders
